settings.title: Step 1: The Keyboard Kit
settings.text: The beauty of custom mechanical keyboards is that there are a ton of different keyboard sizes. We will makes it incredibly easy for you to choose the correct kit. We have a recommended keyboard build for under $200 that ships out in a few days but it does not have the ultra-customized parts you would find in a group buy.

settings.title: Step 2: The Switches
settings.text: The switches are where things start to get a little crazy, there are so many options. Picking the right switch depends mainly on your preference. For someone starting out, we recommend Gateron Yellow switches as they are affordable and super smooth. Keep in mind, picking out switches comes down to preference. There is no right or wrong answer.

settings.title: Step 3: The keycaps
settings.text: There are many options out there in different profiles, designs, and materials. They can get quite pricey as well. It‚Äôs not uncommon for a set of keycaps to get up into the $200 range. Of course, you can find them for cheaper, but it‚Äôs important to understand what separates the high-end keycaps from the cheaper ones. This part really sets the aesthetic for your board.
